00020   /**
00021    * \brief Spherical Harmonic series with a correction to the coefficients.
00022    *
00023    * This classes is similar to SphericalHarmonic, except that the coefficients
00024    * \e C<sub>\e nm</sub> are replaced by \e C<sub>\e nm</sub> + \e tau
00025    * C'<sub>\e nm</sub> (and similarly for \e S<sub>\e nm</sub>).
00026    **********************************************************************/
00027 
00028   class GEOGRAPHIC_EXPORT SphericalHarmonic1 {
00029   public:
00030     /**
00031      * Supported normalizations for associate Legendre polynomials.
00032      **********************************************************************/
00033     enum normalization {
00034       /**
00035        * Fully normalized associated Legendre polynomials.  See
00036        * SphericalHarmonic::full for documentation.
00037        *
00038        * @hideinitializer
00039        **********************************************************************/
00040       full = SphericalEngine::full,
00041       /**
00042        * Schmidt semi-normalized associated Legendre polynomials.  See
00043        * SphericalHarmonic::schmidt for documentation.
00044        *
00045        * @hideinitializer
00046        **********************************************************************/
00047       schmidt = SphericalEngine::schmidt,
00048     };
00049 
00050   private:
00051     typedef Math::real real;
00052     SphericalEngine::coeff _c[2];
00053     real _a;
00054     normalization _norm;
00055 
00056   public:
00057     /**
00058      * Constructor with a full set of coefficients specified.
00059      *
00060      * @param[in] C the coefficients \e C<sub>\e nm</sub>.
00061      * @param[in] S the coefficients \e S<sub>\e nm</sub>.
00062      * @param[in] N the maximum degree and order of the sum
00063      * @param[in] C1 the coefficients \e C'<sub>\e nm</sub>.
00064      * @param[in] S1 the coefficients \e S'<sub>\e nm</sub>.
00065      * @param[in] N1 the maximum degree and order of the correction
00066      *   coefficients \e C'<sub>\e nm</sub> and \e S'<sub>\e nm</sub>.
00067      * @param[in] a the reference radius appearing in the definition of the
00068      *   sum.
00069      * @param[in] norm the normalization for the associated Legendre
00070      *   polynomials, either SphericalHarmonic1::full (the default) or
00071      *   SphericalHarmonic1::schmidt.
00072      *
00073      * See SphericalHarmonic for the way the coefficients should be stored.  \e
00074      * N1 should satisfy \e N1 <= \e N.
00075      *
00076      * The class stores <i>pointers</i> to the first elements of \e C, \e S, \e
00077      * C', and \e S'.  These arrays should not be altered or destroyed during
00078      * the lifetime of a SphericalHarmonic object.
00079      **********************************************************************/
00080     SphericalHarmonic1(const std::vector<double>& C,
00081                        const std::vector<double>& S,
00082                        int N,
00083                        const std::vector<double>& C1,
00084                        const std::vector<double>& S1,
00085                        int N1,
00086                        real a, normalization norm = full)
00087       : _a(a)
00088       , _norm(norm) {
00089       if (!(N1 <= N))
00090         throw GeographicErr("N1 cannot be larger that N");
00091       _c[0] = SphericalEngine::coeff(C, S, N);
00092       _c[1] = SphericalEngine::coeff(C1, S1, N1);
00093     }
00094 
00095     /**
00096      * Constructor with a subset of coefficients specified.
00097      *
00098      * @param[in] C the coefficients \e C<sub>\e nm</sub>.
00099      * @param[in] S the coefficients \e S<sub>\e nm</sub>.
00100      * @param[in] N the degree used to determine the layout of \e C and \e S.
00101      * @param[in] nmx the maximum degree used in the sum.  The sum over \e n is
00102      *   from 0 thru \e nmx.
00103      * @param[in] mmx the maximum order used in the sum.  The sum over \e m is
00104      *   from 0 thru min(\e n, \e mmx).
00105      * @param[in] C1 the coefficients \e C'<sub>\e nm</sub>.
00106      * @param[in] S1 the coefficients \e S'<sub>\e nm</sub>.
00107      * @param[in] N1 the degree used to determine the layout of \e C' and \e
00108      *   S'.
00109      * @param[in] nmx1 the maximum degree used for \e C' and \e S'.
00110      * @param[in] mmx1 the maximum order used for \e C' and \e S'.
00111      * @param[in] a the reference radius appearing in the definition of the
00112      *   sum.
00113      * @param[in] norm the normalization for the associated Legendre
00114      *   polynomials, either SphericalHarmonic1::full (the default) or
00115      *   SphericalHarmonic1::schmidt.
00116      *
00117      * The class stores <i>pointers</i> to the first elements of \e C, \e S, \e
00118      * C', and \e S'.  These arrays should not be altered or destroyed during
00119      * the lifetime of a SphericalHarmonic object.
00120      **********************************************************************/
00121     SphericalHarmonic1(const std::vector<double>& C,
00122                        const std::vector<double>& S,
00123                        int N, int nmx, int mmx,
00124                        const std::vector<double>& C1,
00125                        const std::vector<double>& S1,
00126                        int N1, int nmx1, int mmx1,
00127                        real a, normalization norm = full)
00128       : _a(a)
00129       , _norm(norm) {
00130       if (!(nmx1 <= nmx))
00131         throw GeographicErr("nmx1 cannot be larger that nmx");
00132       if (!(mmx1 <= mmx))
00133         throw GeographicErr("mmx1 cannot be larger that mmx");
00134       _c[0] = SphericalEngine::coeff(C, S, N, nmx, mmx);
00135       _c[1] = SphericalEngine::coeff(C1, S1, N1, nmx1, mmx1);
00136     }
00137 
00138     /**
00139      * A default constructor so that the object can be created when the
00140      * constructor for another object is initialized.  This default object can
00141      * then be reset with the default copy assignment operator.
00142      **********************************************************************/
00143     SphericalHarmonic1() {}
00144 
00145     /**
00146      * Compute a spherical harmonic sum with a correction term.
00147      *
00148      * @param[in] tau multiplier for correction coefficients \e C' and \e S'.
00149      * @param[in] x cartesian coordinate.
00150      * @param[in] y cartesian coordinate.
00151      * @param[in] z cartesian coordinate.
00152      * @return \e V the spherical harmonic sum.
00153      *
00154      * This routine requires constant memory and thus never throws
00155      * an exception.
00156      **********************************************************************/
00157     Math::real operator()(real tau, real x, real y, real z) const throw() {
00158       real f[] = {1, tau};
00159       real v = 0;
00160       real dummy;
00161       switch (_norm) {
00162       case full:
00163         v = SphericalEngine::Value<false, SphericalEngine::full, 2>
00164           (_c, f, x, y, z, _a, dummy, dummy, dummy);
00165         break;
00166       case schmidt:
00167         v = SphericalEngine::Value<false, SphericalEngine::schmidt, 2>
00168           (_c, f, x, y, z, _a, dummy, dummy, dummy);
00169         break;
00170       }
00171       return v;
00172     }
00173 
00174     /**
00175      * Compute a spherical harmonic sum with a correction term and its
00176      * gradient.
00177      *
00178      * @param[in] tau multiplier for correction coefficients \e C' and \e S'.
00179      * @param[in] x cartesian coordinate.
00180      * @param[in] y cartesian coordinate.
00181      * @param[in] z cartesian coordinate.
00182      * @param[out] gradx \e x component of the gradient
00183      * @param[out] grady \e y component of the gradient
00184      * @param[out] gradz \e z component of the gradient
00185      * @return \e V the spherical harmonic sum.
00186      *
00187      * This is the same as the previous function, except that the components of
00188      * the gradients of the sum in the \e x, \e y, and \e z directions are
00189      * computed.  This routine requires constant memory and thus never throws
00190      * an exception.
00191      **********************************************************************/
00192     Math::real operator()(real tau, real x, real y, real z,
00193                           real& gradx, real& grady, real& gradz) const throw() {
00194       real f[] = {1, tau};
00195       real v = 0;
00196       switch (_norm) {
00197       case full:
00198         v = SphericalEngine::Value<true, SphericalEngine::full, 2>
00199           (_c, f, x, y, z, _a, gradx, grady, gradz);
00200         break;
00201       case schmidt:
00202         v = SphericalEngine::Value<true, SphericalEngine::schmidt, 2>
00203           (_c, f, x, y, z, _a, gradx, grady, gradz);
00204         break;
00205       }
00206       return v;
00207     }
00208 
00209     /**
00210      * Create a CircularEngine to allow the efficient evaluation of several
00211      * points on a circle of latitude at a fixed value of \e tau.
00212      *
00213      * @param[in] tau the multiplier for the correction coefficients.
00214      * @param[in] p the radius of the circle.
00215      * @param[in] z the height of the circle above the equatorial plane.
00216      * @param[in] gradp if true the returned object will be able to compute the
00217      *   gradient of the sum.
00218      * @return the CircularEngine object.
00219      *
00220      * SphericalHarmonic1::operator()() exchanges the order of the sums in the
00221      * definition, i.e., sum(n = 0..N)[sum(m = 0..n)[...]] becomes sum(m =
00222      * 0..N)[sum(n = m..N)[...]].  SphericalHarmonic1::Circle performs the
00223      * inner sum over degree \e n (which entails about \e N<sup>2</sup>
00224      * operations).  Calling CircularEngine::operator()() on the returned
00225      * object performs the outer sum over the order \e m (about \e N
00226      * operations).  This routine may throw a bad_alloc exception in the
00227      * GeographicLib::CircularEngine constructor.
00228      *
00229      * See SphericalHarmonic::Circle for an example of its use.
00230      **********************************************************************/
00231     CircularEngine Circle(real tau, real p, real z, bool gradp) const {
00232       real f[] = {1, tau};
00233       switch (_norm) {
00234       case full:
00235         return gradp ?
00236           SphericalEngine::Circle<true, SphericalEngine::full, 2>
00237           (_c, f, p, z, _a) :
00238           SphericalEngine::Circle<false, SphericalEngine::full, 2>
00239           (_c, f, p, z, _a);
00240         break;
00241       case schmidt:
00242       default:                  // To avoid compiler warnings
00243         return gradp ?
00244           SphericalEngine::Circle<true, SphericalEngine::schmidt, 2>
00245           (_c, f, p, z, _a) :
00246           SphericalEngine::Circle<false, SphericalEngine::schmidt, 2>
00247           (_c, f, p, z, _a);
00248         break;
00249       }
00250     }
00251   };
00252 
00253 } // namespace GeographicLib
